result.execSummary:
The defendant Jason R Rayford was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine and costs to be paid at $25.00 per month commencing 01/15/2016 and each month thereafter or penatly of 11 days jail, consecutive for non-payment.

Costs to be paid along with fine payments.

  Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
Straight Time. STAYED - Pending completion of the community service and payment of costs/fine.
Perform 100 Hours of Community Service by 12/10/2016 and submit proof to court.

records.addlTxt:
100 hours of community service completed.
Reviewed by Judge Aprahamian 6/6/17.

Attorney Mark Emil Kershek in court.   Defendant Jason R Rayford did not appear.   Abbey Nickolie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Kershek is requesting an adjournment to receive verification.  Defendant's appearance is waived.  Court sets for check case.  Check Case scheduled for June 26, 2017.

From WCS received 5/24/17 re defendant's failure to complete community service.
Reviewed by Judge Aprahamian 5/25/17.
Review hearing on May 26, 2017 at 10:00 am.

Attorney Mark Emil Kershek in court.   Defendant Jason R Rayford did not appear.   Bryan C. Bayer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The Defendant was ordered to complete 100 hours of community service and the court would offset the fine/costs at a rate of $10.00.  The Court grants an extension and schedules a hearing for late May, 2017.   The Defendant is to work with WCS.  If the Defendant completes the community service and verification is provided to the Court, the May 26, 2017 hearing will be removed from the calendar.  Review hearing scheduled for May 26, 2017 at 10:00 am.
From WCS dated 12/9/16 re failure to complete community service.
Review hearing on December 12, 2016 at 08:30 am.

with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Jason R Rayford in court with attorney Mark E. Kershek.  Kristi J Gordon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 2.  Court finds defendant guilty.  Count #1 is dismissed and read in.   The defendant was sentenced as follows:  Count #2
FINE: $379.00 (to be paid at $25.00 per month commencing 1/15/16).
DNA SURCHARGE: $200.00 (to be paid as part of payment plan on fine).
  Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
Perform 100 hours community service by 12/10/16.
JAIL:  20 DAYS JAIL Straight Time (STAYED pending completion of community service and payment of fine).
The Court schedules a review hearing in one year to address completion of community service and payment of fine.

Defendant Jason R Rayford in court, in custody, with attorney Nicholas Martinez.   Abbey Nickolie appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense advises they can't proceed with a plea/sentencing today. There are victim notification rights. State requests 2 - 3 weeks for a plea/sentencing hearing. Court grants request. Bail addressed by Defense. State objects to bail modification. Court modifies bail to $500.00 signature bond with the same conditions.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 19, 2015 at 10:30 am.
